Variables

RefDict global_ref (RefDict::SCOPE_GLOBAL)
RefStack ref_stack = init_stack()

Detailed Description

The implementation details of the s-expression evaluator. All functions are encapulated except eval().

CHANGES:

  • Fix a bug that prevent (quote ()) from calling
  • Support more Scheme functionalities e.g. define, not, print, eval, <
  • Use STL map to store the symbol definition

Typedef Documentation

typedef vector<RefDict*> RefStack

Cell *const   argv_list 
) throw (runtime_error)

Applying a list of arguments to a procedure.

Returns:
Result from evaluating the procedure.

Cell* eval ( Cell *const   c  ) 

Evaluate the expression tree whose root is pointed to by c (error if c does not hold a well-formed expression).

Returns:
The value resulting from evaluating the expression.

Cell * get_fval ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Get the final value of a given Cell c. The final value can be null.

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the value evaluated from c.

Cell * get_nnfval ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Get the non-null final value of a given Cell c. The final value cannot be null (error if the result is null).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the value evaluated from c.

Initialize a stack of RefDict.

Returns:
The resulting stack.

Cell * lookup_stack ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Overloaded version of the lookup_stack(string s). Automatically convert SymbolCell in argument to string.

Returns:
A pointer to the corresponding cell if found, otherwise, exception.

Cell * lookup_stack ( string  s  )  throw (runtime_error)

Look up a specific symbol in the whole stack from top to bottom.

Returns:
A pointer to the corresponding cell if found, otherwise, exception.

Cell * make_num ( bool &  is_int,
double  n 
) throw (runtime_error)

Create a IntCell or DoubleCell depending on the value of is_int. The value of Cell is calculated from n.

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell if is_int is true, otherwise DoubleCell. Both storing the value of n.

Evaluate all branches of a tree to form a linear list.

Returns:
Head of the resulting list.

Apply c to cdr of c. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
Result from evaluating the procedure.

Cell * operand_car ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the car cell of a given ConsCell c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell which is the car cell of c.

Cell * operand_cdr ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the cdr cell of a given ConsCell c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell which is the cdr cell of c.

Cell * operand_ceiling ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the ceil value of a DoubleCell c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell resulting from the operation.

Cell * operand_cons ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the result of if function using c as the first argument. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the value evaluating from the 2nd or the 3rd argument (the 2nd if c stores non-zero, the 3rd if c stores 0).

Cell * operand_define ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Define a given symbol with a number (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
null always.

Cell * operand_diff ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the difference of operands starting from c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to cell resulting from the operation. (IntCell if all numbers to be substracted is int, otherwise, DoubleCell).

Cell * operand_eval ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Evaluate c once (cancelling the effect of quote once). (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the evaluation result.

Cell * operand_floor ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the floor value of a DoubleCell c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell resulting from the operation.

Cell * operand_if ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the result of if function using c as the first argument. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the value evaluating from the 2nd or the 3rd argument (the 2nd if c stores non-zero, the 3rd if c stores 0).

Cell * operand_lambda ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Create a ProcedureCell using c as formals and cdr of c as body. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell storing the resulting ProcedureCell.

Cell * operand_lessthan ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Check whether the value of a list of numbers monotonically increases. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell storing 1 if the above condition holds, otherwise, a pointer to IntCell storing 0.

Cell * operand_let ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Use a list of argument-value pairs stored in c to apply the cdr of c. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
Result from evaluating the procedure.

Cell * operand_not ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Check whether the value of a cell equals 0 or 0.0. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell storing 1 if the above condition holds, otherwise, a pointer to IntCell storing 0.

Cell * operand_nullp ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Check whether a given Cell c is null. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to IntCell storing 1 if c is null, otherwise, a pointer to IntCell storing 0.

Cell * operand_print ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Print the evaluation result of c to output stream. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
null always.

Cell * operand_product ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the product of operands starting from c. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to cell resulting from the operation (IntCell if all numbers to be substracted is int, otherwise, DoubleCell).

Cell * operand_quote ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Prevent a cell being evaluated once (Directly output the structure without evaluation). (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
null always.

Cell * operand_quotient ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the quotient of operands starting from c. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to Cell resulting from the operation (IntCell if all numbers to be substracted is int, otherwise, DoubleCell).

Cell * operand_sum ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Give the sum of operands starting from c. Evaluate any branch in the tree. (error if c does not hold well-formed arguments).

Returns:
A pointer to cell that contains either int or double value. (int if all numbers to be summed is int, otherwise, double).

Cell * pair_left ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Transform a list of pair into a linear list containing the left value. i.e. ((a 1) (b 2) (c 3) ...) into (a b c ...).

Returns:
Head of the resulting list.

Cell * pair_right ( Cell *const   c  )  throw (runtime_error)

Transform a list of pair into a linear list containing the right value. i.e. ((a 1) (b 2) (c 3) ...) into (1 2 3 ...).

Returns:
Head of the resulting list.
